text: Brat is Charli XCX's sixth studio album. The album consists of singles including the "360", "Von Dutch", "Girl, So Confusing", "Apple" and "Guess". ==Release== Brat was released on June 7, 2024. A deluxe edition, titled Brat and It's the Same but There's Three More Songs So It's Not, was released on June 10. The album consists of three additional songs. On June 21, a remix version of "Girl, So Confusing" featuring New Zealander singer Lorde was released. On 1 August, a remix version of "Guess" from the deluxe edition was released featuring singer Billie Eilish. The following day, "Apple" was released to Italian radio as the album's third single. ==Accolades== Award Year Result Mercury Prize 2024 ==Track list== Notes * All tracks are stylized in sentence case. * signifies an additional producer. * signifies a vocal producer. * "Guess" contains an interpolation of "Technologic" (2005), written by Thomas Bangalter and Guy-Manuel de Homem-Christo, and performed by Daft Punk. * "Spring Breakers" contains an interpolation of "Everytime" (2003), written by Britney Spears and Annet Artani, and performed by Spears. ==Personnel== * Charli XCX – vocals, executive production, design, layout * Randy Merrill – mastering * Idania Valencia – mastering (tracks 1–5, 7–18) * Manny Marroquin – mixing (tracks 1, 8) * Tom Norris – mixing (tracks 2, 3, 5, 6, 10, 13) * Bart Schoudel – mixing, vocal engineering (tracks 4, 12) * Gesaffelstein – mixing (tracks 4, 12) * Geoff Swan – mixing (tracks 7, 9, 11, 14–18) * Cirkut – vocal engineering (tracks 1, 8) * George Daniel – vocal engineering (tracks 2, 11) * Jon Shave – vocal engineering (tracks 3, 9) * Finn Keane – vocal engineering (tracks 3, 14) * A. G. Cook – vocal engineering (tracks 5, 7, 10, 13, 14, 16), executive production * Ashley Jacobson – vocal recording (track 6) * Hudson Mohawke – vocal engineering (track 13) * Matt Cahill – mixing assistance (tracks 7, 9, 11, 14–18) * Darin Lewis – promotion, listener, approvals * Special Offer – design, layout * Imogene Strauss – design, layout ==Reception== The album has a 95/100 rating on Metacritic, meaning "universal acclaim." It is the highest-rated album of 2024 and 14th- highest rated album of all time on the site. ==Charts== Chart performance for Brat Chart (2024) Peak position Australian Dance Albums (ARIA) 1 Croatian International Albums (HDU) 1 Greek Albums (IFPI) 66 Icelandic Albums (Tónlistinn) 8 Japanese Download Albums (Billboard Japan) 50 Lithuanian Albums (AGATA) 7 Swedish Albums (Sverigetopplistan) 12 ==Certifications== ==References== Category:2024 albums Category:Charli XCX albums
title: Brat (album)
